New Records: Olivier Giroud made his 33rd appearance at a major tournament for France, setting a new record that surpasses the previous record-holder Lilian Thuram.
Key Match Events: Robert Lewandowski scored a re-taken penalty in the 79th minute to equalize for Poland.
Kylian Mbappé scored a penalty in the 56th minute to give France the lead.
France and Poland ended the match in a 1-1 draw.
Lukasz Skorupski made several crucial saves to keep Poland in the game.
Mbappé had a penalty shout in injury time that was not awarded by the referee or VAR.
Świderski was booked for a rugby tackle on Hernandez in the 90th minute.
Giroud was fouled by Dawidowicz, who received a yellow card in the 89th minute.
Griezmann had a close chance saved by Skorupski in the 86th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was held at the BVB Stadion Dortmund.
France needed a win to secure a more favorable position in the tournament draw.
Post-Match Reflections: France's failure to hold onto their lead means they are now in the same side of the draw as hosts Germany, Spain, and Portugal.
France settled for second place in Group D, while Poland finished fourth.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on June 25, 2024.
The result means France will face tougher opponents in the knockout stages.
